pages.title: Business transactions of a cab company

elements.name: question1
rows: Passengers pay the fare for completed journeys in cash.
The cab company buys a new vehicle against invoice.
An invoice arrives from a garage for service work on vehicles.
The garage invoice is settled by bank transfer.
A loan debt is repaid by bank transfer.
The interest on the loan debt is transferred by the bank.
The cab company receives an invoice for the vehicle insurance.
The owner increases his deposit by transferring it to the bank account.
The cab company transfers the rent for the office through the bank.
Gasoline purchases for the vehicles are paid in cash.
A used vehicle is sold against invoice.
The wages of the drivers are transferred by the bank.
A customer settles the cab company's claim by transferring it to the bank.
The telephone bill for the last month arrives.
The bank credits interest to the cab company's account.
